alternateName: Predict whether a variant will have conflicting clinical classifications.

distribution.name: archive.zip
distribution.description: Archive containing all the contents of the Genetic Variant Classifications dataset

distribution.name: clinvar_conflicting.csv
distribution.description:
The raw ClinVar vcf file can be found: 
ftp://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pub/clinvar/vcf_GRCh37/clinvar.vcf.gz

The scripts used to process the dataset can be found in this repository: https://github.com/arvkevi/clinvar-kaggle

More information on many of the features can be found at these two links:
https://useast.ensembl.org/info/docs/tools/vep/vep_formats.html#output

https://useast.ensembl.org/info/genome/variation/prediction/predicted_data.html#consequences

field.name: CHROM
field.description: Chromosome the variant is located on

field.name: POS
field.description: Position on the chromosome the variant is located on.

field.name: REF
field.description: Reference Allele

field.name: ALT
field.description: Alternaete Allele

field.name: AF_ESP
field.description: Allele frequencies from GO-ESP

field.name: AF_EXAC
field.description: Allele frequencies from ExAC

field.name: AF_TGP
field.description: Allele frequencies from the 1000 genomes project

field.name: CLNDISDB
field.description: Tag-value pairs of disease database name and identifier, e.g. OMIM:NNNNNN

field.name: CLNDISDBINCL
field.description: For included Variant: Tag-value pairs of disease database name and identifier, e.g. OMIM:NNNNNN

field.name: CLNDN
field.description: ClinVar's preferred disease name for the concept specified by disease identifiers in CLNDISDB

field.name: CLNDNINCL
field.description: For included Variant : ClinVar's preferred disease name for the concept specified by disease identifiers in CLNDISDB

field.name: CLNHGVS
field.description: Top-level (primary assembly, alt, or patch) HGVS expression.

field.name: CLNSIGINCL
field.description: Clinical significance for a haplotype or genotype that includes this variant. Reported as pairs of VariationID:clinical significance.

field.name: CLNVC
field.description: Variant Type

field.name: CLNVI
field.description: the variant's clinical sources reported as tag-value pairs of database and variant identifier

field.name: MC
field.description: comma separated list of molecular consequence in the form of Sequence Ontology ID|molecular_consequence

field.name: ORIGIN
field.description: Allele origin. One or more of the following values may be added: 0 - unknown; 1 - germline; 2 - somatic; 4 - inherited; 8 - paternal; 16 - maternal; 32 - de-novo; 64 - biparental; 128 - uniparental; 256 - not-tested; 512 - tested-inconclusive; 1073741824 - other

field.name: SSR
field.description: Variant Suspect Reason Codes. One or more of the following values may be added: 0 - unspecified, 1 - Paralog, 2 - byEST, 4 - oldAlign, 8 - Para_EST, 16 - 1kg_failed, 1024 - other

field.name: CLASS
field.description: The binary representation of the target class. 0 represents no conflicting submissions and 1 represents conflicting submissions.

field.name: Allele
field.description: the variant allele used to calculate the consequence

field.name: Consequence
field.description: Type of consequence: https://useast.ensembl.org/info/genome/variation/prediction/predicted_data.html#consequences

field.name: IMPACT
field.description: the impact modifier for the consequence type

field.name: SYMBOL
field.description: Gene Name

field.name: Feature_type
field.description: type of feature. Currently one of Transcript, RegulatoryFeature, MotifFeature.

field.name: Feature
field.description: Ensembl stable ID of feature

field.name: BIOTYPE
field.description: Biotype of transcript or regulatory feature

field.name: EXON
field.description: the exon number (out of total number)

field.name: INTRON
field.description: the intron number (out of total number)

field.name: cDNA_position
field.description: relative position of base pair in cDNA sequence

field.name: CDS_position
field.description: relative position of base pair in coding sequence

field.name: Protein_position
field.description: relative position of amino acid in protein

field.name: Amino_acids
field.description: only given if the variant affects the protein-coding sequence

field.name: Codons
field.description: the alternative codons with the variant base in upper case

field.name: DISTANCE
field.description: Shortest distance from variant to transcript

field.name: STRAND
field.description: defined as + (forward) or - (reverse).

field.name: BAM_EDIT
field.description: Indicates success or failure of edit using BAM file

field.name: SIFT
field.description: the SIFT prediction and/or score, with both given as prediction(score)

field.name: PolyPhen
field.description: the PolyPhen prediction and/or score

field.name: MOTIF_NAME
field.description: the source and identifier of a transcription factor binding profile aligned at this position

field.name: MOTIF_POS
field.description: The relative position of the variation in the aligned TFBP

field.name: HIGH_INF_POS
field.description: a flag indicating if the variant falls in a high information position of a transcription factor binding profile (TFBP)

field.name: MOTIF_SCORE_CHANGE
field.description: The difference in motif score of the reference and variant sequences for the TFBP

field.name: LoFtool
field.description:
Loss of Function tolerance score for loss of function variants:
https://github.com/konradjk/loftee

field.name: CADD_PHRED
field.description: Phred-scaled CADD score.

field.name: CADD_RAW
field.description:
Score of the deleteriousness of variants:
http://cadd.gs.washington.edu/

field.name: BLOSUM62
field.description: See: http://rosalind.info/glossary/blosum62/

recordSet.name: clinvar_conflicting.csv
recordSet.description:
The raw ClinVar vcf file can be found: 
ftp://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pub/clinvar/vcf_GRCh37/clinvar.vcf.gz

The scripts used to process the dataset can be found in this repository: https://github.com/arvkevi/clinvar-kaggle

More information on many of the features can be found at these two links:
https://useast.ensembl.org/info/docs/tools/vep/vep_formats.html#output

https://useast.ensembl.org/info/genome/variation/prediction/predicted_data.html#consequences

keywords: subject > earth and nature > biology > genetics
subject > health and fitness > health > medicine
subject > health and fitness > health > healthcare
name: Genetic Variant Classifications
description:
### Context

[ClinVar](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/clinvar/) is a public resource containing annotations about human genetic variants. These variants are (usually manually) classified by clinical laboratories on a categorical spectrum ranging from benign, likely benign, uncertain significance, likely pathogenic, and pathogenic. Variants that have conflicting classifications (from laboratory to laboratory) can cause confusion when clinicians or researchers try to interpret whether the variant has an impact on the disease of a given patient.  

### Content

The objective is to predict whether a ClinVar variant will have **conflicting classifications**. This is presented here as a binary classification problem, where each record in the dataset is a genetic **variant**.

![conflicting variants figure][1]

Conflicting classifications are when two of any of the following three categories are present for one variant, two submissions of one category are not considered conflicting.

1. Likely Benign or Benign
2. VUS
3. Likely Pathogenic or Pathogenic

Conflicting classification has been assigned to the `CLASS` column. It is a binary representation of whether or not a variant has conflicting classifications, where `0` represents consistent classifications and `1` represents conflicting classifications.

Since this problem only relates to variants with multiple classifications, I removed all variants from the original ClinVar `.vcf` which only had one submission.

The raw variant call format (vcf) file was downloaded here on Saturday, April 7th, 2018:
[ftp://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pub/clinvar/vcf_GRCh37/clinvar.vcf.gz][2]

Scripts used to generate this file in [this repo](https://github.com/arvkevi/clinvar-kaggle)

### Acknowledgements

Landrum MJ, Lee JM, Benson M, Brown GR, Chao C, Chitipiralla S, Gu B, Hart J, Hoffman D, Jang W, Karapetyan K, Katz K, Liu C, Maddipatla Z, Malheiro A, McDaniel K, Ovetsky M, Riley G, Zhou G, Holmes JB, Kattman BL, Maglott DR. ClinVar: improving access to variant interpretations and supporting evidence. Nucleic Acids Res. 2018 Jan 4. PubMed PMID: 29165669.

### Inspiration

I'm exploring ideas for applying machine learning to genomics. I'm hoping this dataset will encourage others to think about the additional feature engineering that's necessary to confidently assess the objective. There could be a benefit to identifying *single submission* variants that may yet to have assigned a **conflicting classification**.


  [1]: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/arvkevi/clinvar-kaggle/master/clinvar-class-fig.png
  [2]: ftp://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pub/clinvar/vcf_GRCh37/
